thread.title: Scouting report: Would Thomas Meunier or Nelson Semedo be a better signing for Man United? | Metro News
thread.title_full: Scouting report: Would Thomas Meunier or Nelson Semedo be a better signing for Man United? | Metro News

author: George Bellshaw For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Scouting report: Would Thomas Meunier or Nelson Semedo be a better signing for Man United? | Metro News
text:
Scouting report: Would Thomas Meunier or Nelson Semedo be a better signing for Manchester United? opinion George Bellshaw for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 14 Feb 2017 9:40 pm Meunier and Semedo could be decent options for United (Picture: Getty) 
Manchester United are believed to be in the market for a new right-back this summer, with Jose Mourinho keen to strengthen his defensive options. 
Two realistic options for the Red Devils were both in action on Tuesday night, with both playing in Champions League ties. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
Nelson Semedo, who has been heavily linked with a £34million move to both United and Chelsea, was pitted against Marco Reus as Benfica hosted Borussia Dortmund. 
Meanwhile, Thomas Meunier, who earlier admitted he’d love to play for United in the future, would have to cope with Neymar as Paris Saint-Germain took on Barcelona. 
Here we take a look at both players as PSG thumped Barcelona 4-0 and Benfica scrapped to a dogged 1-0 win over Dortmund. Defending Meunier largely dealt with Neymar (Picture: AFP/Getty) 
In the first half, Meunier largely had Neymar in his pocket. 
The Belgian stood the Brazilian up well whenever he ran at him and he dealt with the tricky attacker comfortably whenever he was isolated. 
Semedo also looked decent when one-on-one with Reus but made a few rash challenges when he was drawn inside, with one leading to a glorious opportunity for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, which the Gabon international blazed over. 
A similar incident followed in the second half, which allowed Dembele in and there were certainly moments of indecision for the 23-year-old. Attacking Semedo didn’t get forward too often (Picture: Getty) 
Meunier showed his quality with a brilliant cross in the opening exchanges of the match, with his whipped ball narrowly evading Edinson Cavani. 
He went one better in the second half, showing some fabulous skill to skip past Neymar then strolled through Barcelona’s half before releasing Cavani to add a fourth on a fantastic night at the Parc des Princes. 
Semedo found himself pegged back by Reus more often than not and didn’t really get the opportunity to shine in an attacking capacity.
